text: Houston Academy is our home away from home. You feel like family when you enter the school. Everyone is warm and inviting. You are called by name from the faculty and administrators. We have two children that are pushed academically and we feel certain will become successful adults. This is a college preparatory school and your children are well prepared for college. We love being a part of the Houston  Academy Raiders.

name: Erin Kelly
text: More than anything, I feel like Houston Academy teaches your children to strive for excellence academically.  It is the only college preparatory school in our area. The faculty, parents, and students strive for excellence collectively in all areas, teaching our children integrity and to be well-rounded individuals that are ready for college and the rest of the world when they finish!  It is a family and there is NO place like it!

It just breaks my heart from the racially comments spoke from this school. My children are now part of Providence Christian School, and I don’t regret a thing. text:
Are you serious....? And, you are a principal??? Thank you for staying in Alabama.  Washington state  would not welcome you...not with this selfish attitude.   SHAME ON YOU for not complimenting Brice for taking his grandmother to the prom.  What a compliment he paid her and showed her love and appreciation.
How can you seriously consider yourself an example of a gentleman?  I would say your family is embarrassed by this horrible decision.
NO, these are not mean words...factual.
Signing off as a  mother who would have been very proud of my son for inviting grandma.
SHAME ON YOU.....now he is staying home, too.
Almost ready to pick up the phone earlier and call you....disgusting!!!

name: Milk Carton Productions
text: The fact the principal could not make a simple request happen is ridiculous.  It's not like the kid is bringing his 25 or 35 year old date or asking to bring an escort.  He is a kid whose parents taxes and his too go to ensure the county has money to hire closed minded people like this principal and the "school board."  If you spent half as much time making future leaders instead of building your own ego, every problem wouldn't seem like a nail.

name: REAL WORLD SPICE
text: Eufaula schools have went down hill since 2006. The high school is basically a joke. All they want is money. They nickel and dime you to death. The teachers,not all but most,never give home work or hands on for the most part. Ever since the invention of these "chrome books" learning has took a back seat to self teaching. The act scores have declined to the point they cant get you into ymca..joke? Eufaula was ranked around 78th in all Alabamas schools..now around 270th..if thats not a decline what is? The bad thing about it is our kids are suffering..

text: The school is very dirty it has rats in it!! I really don't have understand why it isn't shut down I'm taking this to the district because it doesn't make any since at all!!!How I can't come into a clean school the janiyoj doesn't come and clean up the classes trash is everywhere floors are disgusting.Teachers barely teach and expect us to pass a exam.

name: Shaun Capps
text: Great school. Nice students.

name: Vickie Thompson
text:
My grandson goes to school here. He has a IEP He has his heart in his work. He helps him on every day high school experiences. He helps him to resolve issues he faces in school in general. He has helped him to resolve issues with the crowded lunchroom breakfast, lunch. He eats in a specific area so he can enjoy eating meals like other
people in the school rather than not eating. His math score has went up. This school staff will as a hole help with anything a student needs to have and be at their very best in and out of school. He is in the ninth grade he likes this school over all and wants to continue going to school here until he graduates. They have a great school counselor. She works hard with my grandson to help him with any questions he has concerning anything. The school nurse is really nice and works with him knowing what his needs are and specific needs and concerns we discuss. Students with specific needs will benefit going to school here. My grandson is doing good and this is a big family destressor.

This is a great school..!!!!!

text: Best time ever

name: Chris Rollins
text: On point

name: Quentin S
text: Class of 06

name: Lance G
text: These folks are awesome Christian teachers.  Outstanding learning environment, with knowledgeable, professional staff. It's clear they truly love what they do. Highly recommended for education of children of various ages.

name: Daniel Stephens
text: Huntsville Christian Academy is an exceptionally amazing school. The individual attention that each child receives is extremely valuable to me as a parent. You can really tell that the teachers love the children and get excited when they succeed and excel in their studies. The volleyball, basketball and other athletic programs are just as good, if not better, than public school. Additionally, the children are encouraged to be respectful, obey their parents and live with integrity. What more could you ask for...?

name: Saul Fitzgerald
text: My son is in his 1st year at Huntsville Christian Academy. The teachers really do a great job of keeping me informed on all of his classes and everything like that. His core courses are good and he also takes art as an elective and really enjoys it. I'm very happy with the school.

name: Vanessa Holland
text: I love Huntsville Christian Academy, because they allow my son to work at his own pace. We have tried other private schools and HCA has been the only school that can challenge him academically. The classes are small and the students really look out for one another. Pastor Reggie is a great mentor and is always willing to the take time to help his students and pray with them whenever needed.

name: benonai
text: School is great for the price. The Pace format makes it tailorable to individual needs. The atmosphere is good for the kids., and they get a strong, biblical message and instruction as well. As they continue to grow, hopefully more extracurricular will be offered.

name: Joshua French
text: I very much like the curriculum here. The school does a good job of instilling a strong Christian learning in their students. The class sizes are nice as well, it doesn't let the kids get lost. Praise God for this school!

name: Marie Glor
text: The positive atmosphere at Huntsville Christian Academy is truly inspiring. My son feels so comfortable and loves going to class everyday. They are doing everything right there, so keep up the good work!

name: Mary McNairy
text: HCA has been a blessing to our family. Our daughter's teacher is wonderful, and the staff is very supportive. Absolutely love it!

name: Thomas Patrick
text: They are serious about instilling discipline and integrity right away. The courses are good, and they actually will take the time to listen to the parents if you have any input on something you think could be done better.

name: Katie Harris
text: My daughter is very happy. But what I really like is that she is getting the best education and that's what matters. She will be thanking me later.

name: Iris Johnson
text: The BEST place for a child to grow as an individual and as a child of God, through daily chapel. Love how the build character, love for our country, morals and standards where needs to be, creating godly leaders for generations to come.

name: XEX archive
text: Hi, im Maddox in 7th currently, I LOVE this school and have been here two years now. I really encourage going to this school.

name: Tina Polk
text: While academics are important, so is the love every staff member has for Christ and the students at Huntsville Christian Academy.  The school has a great atmosphere.

name: Lashay Amore
text: My nephew attended HCA for four years beginning in the 3rd grade, before relocating to California. From the initial meeting with Pastor Reggie, my family knew this was "home."  My nephew felt immediately comfortable with Pastor Reggie, and we knew he would feel happy and safe here. This was of upmost importance, and HCA did not disappoint.

name: Bryan Jennings
text: Im one of the students, and this is probably the best thing that has ever happened to me.

name: Faith Williams
text: This place has been nothing but a blessing to our family!! The school has challenged my son and he has rose to the challenge and excelled!!!

name: Milissa Gainey

text: Huntsville Christian Academy is a school where a student can feel safe without peer pressure of being in unwanted groups; therefore, he or she can concentrate on their academics.

name: Chameka Thompson
text: Freshman year my son was well adjusted finally after not wanting to go then here comes sophomore year (currently). Now he’s popular and well mannered clean and the harassment and embarrassment is approaching fast. He cannot go to class and back home without someone complaining about him! I don’t like it! Administration is assuming that anything going on has to do with my child and it is very discomforting for him to be a 15 year old and not enjoy his high school years with people that favors 1 class of kids over the other! Be careful everything that looks good is not! Dealing with Ms Kidd has been wonderful but others not so much!

Happy to be graduating at the high school my father graduated from

text: This school is awful I was bullied on my first day there not only that I've been sexually assaulted  and threatened to get beat up and nothing was done about it this school is full dumb ghetto children who can barely read

name: Anne Jones
text: Great for youth! Wonderful people & program!!

name: angie gilchrist
text: Mathnasium has been great for us when my kid's online math class wasn't as great as what we were used to as in person classes.  Crystal worked with me to help get my kid where they needed to be when they return in the classroom. Our tutor was fabulous. He was patient and encouraging to my child. I highly recommend Mathnasium.

resp.text: Thank you...it's great to hear...Crystal  and our instructors appreciate your comments. Keep moving forward!

name: clinton martin
text:
My son who is a 3 rd grader is a bright one and we wanted to find something that was more challenging than what the public school was currently offering. My son got a lot of one to one attention, he enjoyed Math more and ended up winning two awards in Math. His team from elementary school won 3 rd place among Huntsvile city schools and my son won first place in individual competition in his entire grade. We are very grateful to all the teachers who have kept him engaged through a very difficult year. The teachers are all so cool, they know how to talk to kids and engage them. I haven’t seen the rigid teaching style but rather saw a deliberate attempt to teach problem solving by approaching a concept from many different styles. This taught my son valuable lessons that there is more than one way to solve a problem.
Much appreciated and I am planning on getting my second child enrolled anytime now.

resp.text:
Mr. Martin - thank you. This makes our day. It's a great feeling hearing of your son's success.
Russ/Crystal
Mathnasium of Huntsville

name: Tina Clarke
text: My (8th grade) daughter has been struggling with math all year. A friend recommended Mathnasium but my daughter was hesitant and nervous to start. After the very first session, she came out smiling and saying that she loved the tutor she was paired with and that he showed her a new trick that made working the problems so much easier. She had a big math test after only 3 sessions and her score more than doubled. We've only been going a short time, but we've seen her grades continue to go up on every assignment and test. We are so happy we found Mathnasium. We started with a girl that had given up on math and was headed to summer school if not repeating the entire class. My daughter is now confident and actually enjoying math. 2 days ago I overheard her talking to a friend on the phone explaining how to do their math homework. I can't recommend Mathnasium enough to anyone who has a child struggling with math. Crystal is so nice to work with and all of their tutors are amazing! So thankful!

resp.text: Great to hear and thank you for taking the time to share.

name: Melissa Harty
text: So happy we found Mathnasium right here in Huntsville!   My two daughters (age 8 & 9) love going here and the staff/tutors somehow make learning math fun!  They encourage personal goal-setting, and have developed a clever reward system to keep the students striving.   Honestly, mine wish they could attend more than twice per week.  No more home-work struggles and I feel such a burden lifted off my shoulders knowing that I'm supporting them.

resp.text: GREAT to hear! This is what we live for! Look forward to helping in their success.

name: Paula Phillips
text: My daughter had many misgivings about tutoring at first, however everyone at Mathnasium Huntsville has done a wonderful job at making her feel comfortable and supported and this is clearly apparent in her academic performance. Her grades are up and so is her confidence! A big shoutout to Crystal and her crew, thank you for all you do!

resp.text: This is what we live for! Great to hear. Thank you.

name: Chris S
text: Mathnasium significantly helped my child's grades.  You can drop off at anytime during their hours, which is so convenient.   My kids are always smiling when I pick them up.  They have a great rapport with the instructors and like earning the prizes.  The owner and manager are both great people to work with as well-very supportive. Highly recommend Mathnasium to anyone considering signing up.

resp.text: Thank you - our instructors appreciate the shout out. We work hard to assist students of all grades and aid them in their success.

name: Heather Armstrong
text: Miss Crystal loves these kids and their progress. The staff loves what they do and gets the kids to love doing math as well.  We are so lucky we found mathnasium.  It saved so many family fights and helped our daughter find her confidence in her abilities.

resp.text: Glad to assist. We enjoy seeing our students excel and move forward.

name: Nita Herrington
text: Incredibly effective. Straightforward process- filling in knowledge gaps and clarifying topics. Our eighth grade daughter is regaining her confidence in algebra, with improved grades after just a few weeks. Highly recommend.

name: Robyn Wainwright
text: I am so glad we found Mathnasium. My daughter was really struggling with math and I wasn’t able to really help her. The way I was doing it and the way she was learning it was different.  She would get frustrated with me and say, “that’s not how I’m supposed to do it”! So you can imagine the frustration we were both experiencing . The staff at Mathnasium has been great and has helped my daughter a great deal. She is really enjoying it.

resp.text: Thank you Robyn. Great to hear we are assisting.

name: Heather Bookout
text: It's a great environment with great people working there.  Both of my girls like it a lot!.  We got great grade-raising results! They keep it fun with great incentives for the kids.  Plus, we feel totally fine dropping the kids off there and running errands.

name: Kelly Finn Parker
text:
Every instructor at Mathnasium of Huntsville
is exceptional!! They all love what they do and it shows with every child that they help.

resp.text: Kelly, thank you for your comments and 5 star rating. Team Mathnasium

name: Lisa Andrew
text: Great teachers. My daughter loves going there. They make math fun.

resp.text: Lisa, thank you and elated to hear we were able to assist. Team Mathnasium

name: Ben East
text: I've used this service from my Jr year in high school to my Freshman year in college. It has continually provided tremendous value in mathematics. The people and management are excellent and the atmosphere is positive and supportive. There's always a tutor That's able to help you work through a problem and grasp complicated concepts. Mathnasium saved me from having to repeat math classes in the past. Thanks again guys :)

resp.text: Thank you, Ben! You are always a pleasure to have in the center. I appreciate your positive attitude and willingness to learn. I'm excited to see what the future has in store for you! ~Phyllis

name: Erin Boles
text: This was the answer to our prayers! Phyllis Norton, the owner of the franchise in Jones Valley,  is the most amazing person!  The educator shared her own family struggle with her kids and math.  That’s why she opened this business. Her passion is evident! She  and the staff worked diligently and continue to follow up with us to make sure our child is getting what she needs. After many, many tutors and lots of other strategies, Mathnasium was what our child needed.  It offered a family peace that we had not had in a while when it came to math. I highly recommend it  here and continuinally recommend it to friends.

name: William Helmstadter
text: Mathnasium is Amazing!  The Instructors really care and the kids enjoy going!

name: Nate Smith
text: I had an awful experience here my senior year after my family moved here from Illinois. Would highly recommend another school.

name: Brent Bradford
text: Terrible school. I would find somewhere else to go. There are other better quality schools to attend

name: Bonnie Daily
text: Best yet!
